result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesse A. Kost was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jesse A. Kost is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jesse A. Kost was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Jesse A. Kost was found guilty of Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
11:09 am - Defendant Jesse A. Kost in court with attorney Galen Bayne-Allison.  Defendant Jesse A. Kost in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 14cf181 (initial appr), 14cf148 (prelim) and 14cf28 (sehr).    In 14cf181 -   In receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing.  In 14cf181 and 14cf148 - Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over.  State files Information in 14cf148.  Information for 14cf181 will mirror criminal complaint.  Proceed to Arraginment - not guilty pleas entered and set for PTC.  In 14CF181 - Michlig/Bayne Allison to bond.  Court sets cash bond.  Also bond in 14cf148 modified to allow inpatient treatment at Koinonia if unable to post cash.  In 14cf28 - Michlig/Bayne-Allison/Defendant/Court statement to sentencing. 
Court Sentence - Concurrent
Jail 90 days - may attend inpatient treatment and is to receive day for day credit if successfully completes inpatient treatment program - Jail credit 40 days
Court Costs reduced to civil judgment
Appeal rights given  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 11, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on September 11, 2014 at 11:00 am.
from defendant regarding sentencing after revocation

01:30 pm - Defendant Jesse A. Kost in court with attorney Galen Bayne-Allison.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 14cf28 (PTC), 13fo975,13fo1004,14tr479,14tr480 (RH).  In case 14cf28 - State moves to amend Count 1 striking the 2nd or subsequent offense making this an Unclassified Misdemeanor and dismiss counts 3 and 4 - Granted.  Defendant pleads no contest to counts 1 and 2.  Plea questionnaire filed.    Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty.  Michlig/Bayne-Allison/Defendant/Court statement to sentencing.  As for citations - Court sets for review hearing on 12-08-2014 at 10 am.
Court Sentence
WHS/POP 18 months
CC/DNA Surcharge (1 count only)/Supervision Fees
AODA assessment and recovery
Jail credit 2 days
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO
Appeal rights given

01:49 pm - Defendant Jesse A. Kost in court with attorney Galen Bayne-Allison.  Steven M Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Bayne-Allison requests 30 day adjournment.  Citations for review to track along with criminal case. Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 29, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

04:13 pm - Defendant Jesse A. Kost in court with attorney Galen Bayne-Allison.  Susan J. Sommer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also calling 13fo975 and 13fo1004 (Active Warrants).  Bayne-Allison in receipt of Information, waives reading and enters not guilty pleas.  Bail continued.  13fo975 and 13fo101004 - Active Warrants - Court questions defendant as to non-appearance.  Defendant states has a lot going on and overlooked the appearance date.  Defendant states receives Social Security and is attending school at Nicolet.  Court quashes warrant - and grants extension.  Defendant to $100/month.  To start May 2nd and the first week of every month.  Court includes furture appearance citations.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 10, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

03:32 pm - Attorney Galen Bayne-Allison in court. Susan J. Sommer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bayne-Allison files Waiver of Prelim.  Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over.  Bail continued.  Arraignment scheduled for April 7, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery
Preliminary hearing on March 19, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

02:53 pm - Bloom for PFO - Defendant Jesse A. Kost in court with attorney Galen Bayne-Allison.  Susan J Sommer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing - Time limits waived
Bail continued  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 7, 2014 at 09:00 am.

01:49 pm - Defendant Jesse A. Kost in court, via video, in custody.  Michael W Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will contact PD,  Schiek statement to bail - Court sets $ sig bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 17, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
